content.description:
Climb an obvious crack that is about 30 feet to the right of

One Small Step

.
content.location:
Start about 30 feet to the right of

One Small Step

on the northeast face of the Moonstone at an obvious crack.

content.description: 2 pitch route, 3 bolts, 2 bolt anchor Hand crack, OW, face. Route faces East. Formation located between N. Astrodome and Moonstone. see map Vogel p. 296 Belay in crack before the bolted traverse.
content.protection: A trad rack (mostly med to large), QDs for bolts
content.location: Located on an unnamed formation just south of Moonstone. The route faces east.

content.description:
Start just right of

Cosmic Debris

at a right slanting crack. Climb the crack and flakes past two small ceilings to the summit.
content.protection: A standard rack should protect the climb.
content.location:
Start just right of

Cosmic Debris

on the northeast face of the Moonstone at a right slanting crack.

content.description: Steep crack and face moves (5.8/5.9) lead up to a bolt, which protects thin face moves (crux).  Above, a long move right leads to easier going.
content.location: This is roughly in the center of the northeast face, the first crack to the right of the obvious ramp on Anty Matter.

content.description: This cool climb is located left of the climbs in Randy's guidebook. The climb ends under the big roof;.. rap or lower from there.  There are two starts to this climb;..a direct and coming in from the left;...both are the same rating. There are a few bolts on this climb, and maybe a fixed pin.
content.protection: Small to med cams, and QDs for the fixed stuff

content.description: Go up a long, left slanting ramp/flake to its top. Face climb left past two bolts (crux) then up to the top.
content.protection: Two bolts, standard trad gear should protect the climb.
content.location: This route climbs a very obvious left slanting ramp/flake on the northeast face of the Moonstone.
